alert.note: Alert for Amherst; Bedford; Rockbridge (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued November 17 at 7:35AM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EST TONIGHT... The Virginia Department of Environmental Quality has issued a health alert through today and tonight due to unhealthy particle concentrations due to smoke from multiple wildfires across the Commonwealth. The counties affected are: Rockbridge, Bedford, and Amherst. Air quality in those areas ranges from Code Orange to Code Red to Code Maroon, the latter measured by a US Forest Service temporary air pollution monitor in Rockbridge County depending on the smoke plume. Active children and adults should limit or reschedule strenuous outdoor activities until conditions improve. People unusually sensitive to air pollution, especially those with heart or lung disease (including asthma), should avoid strenuous outdoor activities until conditions improve. Take more breaks, do less intense activities. People with asthma should follow their asthma action plans and keep quick-relief medicine handy. In particular, air quality in Rockbridge County is in the hazardous range. Everyone there should significantly cut back on physical activities and sensitive groups should avoid all physical activities. For additional information, please visit the Virginia Department of Environmental Quality at: www.deq.virginia.gov
